page.title: 10Arts/Crafts, Newton/Linton
page.content: Facilities are provided by North Yorkshire County Council Evening Institute for classes in dressmaking, upholstery,crafts and painting.The Newton-on-Ouse Art Group has several painting weekends during the year and holds an annual exhibition. Apart from classes many people are involved in a wide variety of crafts within their homes.One married couple spin and weave and demonstrate outside the immediate area.People are involved in pottery,woodwork,corn dolly making and needlecraft of many varieties.A group of ladies meet as "Kyle Kraft" making items for sale at local events. Both Newton and Nun Monkton Churches have tapestry kneelers made by local ladies and a group of Women's Institute members met to make a patchwork bedspread.
